intro: Dyschoriste trichanthera, commonly known as the slender dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Dyschoriste trichanthera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
